channel.title: EasyRSC Error
channel.description:
Ive been away from anything RSC Now for well over a year, Since my server Piru Online, Demonik & RSCD Based Servers, Wamp, Sql's and No-ips. Alot seems to have changed here and as daft as it sounds im struggling getting back to terms with the changes and seem to be struggling with EasyRSC. Ive figured to add my default gateway to Server.java and replace the localhost address with this. But when the server is put online i get the following error.
Any information would be much appreciated. Thank you. Dayle
I've also tried Ending all java applications as this bind error may of been the address was already up and running and in use.

item.title: EasyRSC Error
item.dc:creator: @elyad elyad
item.description:
@elyad wrote:

Eventually got it up, Done now, Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Error
item.dc:creator: @Universalas Universalas
item.description:
@Universalas wrote:

elayd it is simple to run easyrsc … lol just download new server then …

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Error
item.dc:creator: @elyad elyad
item.description:
@elyad wrote:

Universalas:

if you using router in your home try port foward and in server.java where you put ip addres u put you local addres … like my is 192.168.2.6 then must to be ok … do not forget to compile… if still not working … try to off java in task manager …

Ive already port forwarded and still no use and ended all java.exe applications.

[quote=“The_AFKer, post:9, topic:336759”][quote author=elyad link=topic=433171.msg3180313#msg3180313 date=1271253117]
Because maybe in the future id like to get it up and online, Id just like to know how for peace of mind if i ever did.
[/quote]

You would think you would learn from the past…[/quote]

Well ive been away for well over a year so i am rusty with anything RSC At the moment, Also ive never used EasyRsc. So the setup of it is different for me.

Read full topic
